feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student describes a functioning financial application with specific financial inputs and multiple outputs (charts, cashflow strategy, allocation, monthly savings) and an implemented N8N tool. Given the concrete examples and claimed validation, this meets the moderate requirement for a thorough, working financial app.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates correct and concrete integration of AI at a conceptual level (tool built with AI, produces analyses and charts) but provides limited technical detail about how AI is used or what capabilities it performs, so the integration is clear but not thoroughly documented. Under the MODERATE standard, this shows valid understanding but lacks the depth/explicit examples required for a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I created an AI tool that acts as a goal-oriented investment guide. The goal is to set a goal an individual who is making $150,000 a year and wants to buy a $700,000 home in 5 years."
"For the Implement portion using my N8N tool, I created a practical tool that can generate charts and clear situational analysis based on the parameters ... The interface is very easy to use..."
"It also ... provides a cashflow strategy, investment allocation, um, an annual breakdown. And required monthly savings."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — defined a concrete financial goal and realistic inputs (salary, target price, timeframe).  
Implement — built an N8N-based tool that generates charts, scenario analysis, cashflow strategy, allocations, and monthly savings.  
Verify — asserts the tool "works for a variety of different real world scenarios," indicating functional testing/validation.
criteria.reasoning: The student describes a functioning financial application with specific financial inputs and multiple outputs (charts, cashflow strategy, allocation, monthly savings) and an implemented N8N tool. Given the concrete examples and claimed validation, this meets the moderate requirement for a thorough, working financial app.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: ["I created an AI tool that acts as a goal-oriented investment guide."]
["For the Implement portion using my N8N tool, I created a practical tool that can generate charts and clear situational analysis based on the parameters"]
["using AI was very helpful in this. ... AI has made me much more confident in my ability to analyze different financial scenarios."]
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — student explicitly frames the project as an "AI tool" and a concrete goal (goal-oriented investment guide). Implement — student describes using n8n to produce charts, situational analysis, cashflow strategy and allocations (the tool outputs). Reflect — student reports AI was helpful and boosted confidence, acknowledging AI’s role in development.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates correct and concrete integration of AI at a conceptual level (tool built with AI, produces analyses and charts) but provides limited technical detail about how AI is used or what capabilities it performs, so the integration is clear but not thoroughly documented. Under the MODERATE standard, this shows valid understanding but lacks the depth/explicit examples required for a full PASS.
